H0.text: What is the green pigment used by plants to trap sunlight. Phyllochrom

H1.text: What is the green pigment used by plants to trap sunlight. Chlorogen

H2.text: What is the green pigment used by plants to trap sunlight. Viridin

H3.text: What is the green pigment used by plants to trap sunlight. Chlorafil

A4.text: Chlorophyll is any of several related green pigments found in cyanobacteria and in the chloroplasts of algae and plants.

A5.text: Chlorophyll allows plants to absorb energy from light.

A6.text: Chlorophyll fluorescence, to measure plant stress

A7.text: Chlorophyll a is a specific form of chlorophyll used in oxygenic photosynthesis.

A8.text: In the ocean, phytoplankton all contain the chlorophyll pigment, which has a greenish color.

A9.text: Chlorophyll b is a form of chlorophyll.

A10.text: Chlorophyll b helps in photosynthesis by absorbing light energy.
